required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

lead_sponsor.agency: Fundación para la Investigación del Hospital Clínico de Valencia

clinical_study.source: Fundación para la Investigación del Hospital Clínico de Valencia

brief_summary.textblock:
Although imaging techniques are the reference standard to diagnose alveolar collapse, in the postoperative period and using the peripheral hemoglobin oxygen saturation (SpO2), a non-invasive simple and accurate test (Air-Test) was recently validated to diagnose alveolar collapse.
The aim of this study is to non-invasively describe the incidence of intraoperative atelectasis with the Air-Test in an unselected surgical population. In addition, we attempt to describe the association between positive Air-Test and the patient´s preoperative or intraoperative variables.

primary_outcome.description: Positive Air-Test defined as SpO2 < 97% while breathing room air

clinical_study.condition: Patients With ASA Status I-III Scheduled for Surgery

intervention.description: The Air Test simply consisted in breathing room air for 5 min during anesthesia while measuring peripheral oxygen saturation by Pulse oximetry

study_pop.textblock: The study included consecutive patients who were scheduled for surgery with general anesthesia and mechanical ventilation

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- American Society of Anesthesiologist (ASA) I-IV
- General Anesthesia
- Mechanical ventilation
Exclusion Criteria:
- age < 18 years old
- pregnancy
- patients undergoing cardiothoracic surgery
- ASA physical status V

facility.name: Department of Anesthesia and Critical Care; Hospital Clinico Universitario

reference.citation: Ferrando C, Tusman G, Suarez-Sipmann F, León I, Pozo N, Carbonell J, Puig J, Pastor E, Gracia E, Gutiérrez A, Aguilar G, Belda FJ, Soro M. Individualized lung recruitment maneuver guided by pulse-oximetry in anesthetized patients undergoing laparoscopy: a feasibility study. Acta Anaesthesiol Scand. 2018 May;62(5):608-619. doi: 10.1111/aas.13082. Epub 2018 Jan 29.

Ferrando C, Romero C, Tusman G, Suarez-Sipmann F, Canet J, Dosdá R, Valls P, Villena A, Serralta F, Jurado A, Carrizo J, Navarro J, Parrilla C, Romero JE, Pozo N, Soro M, Villar J, Belda FJ. The accuracy of postoperative, non-invasive Air-Test to diagnose atelectasis in healthy patients after surgery: a prospective, diagnostic pilot study. BMJ Open. 2017 May 29;7(5):e015560. doi: 10.1136/bmjopen-2016-015560.

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Fundación para la Investigación del Hospital Clínico de Valencia
